meanings.definition: Assist in bringing forth or bringing about
meanings.sent1: She was midwiving the new project into existence.
meanings.sent2: The team was midwiving a plan for the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician's assistant was midwiving a rabbit out of the hat.
meanings.sent4: Her words were midwiving a sense of calm in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was midwiving a beautiful garden from the seeds.

meanings.definition: To help in the birth of a baby
meanings.sent1: The nurse was midwiving the baby with care.
meanings.sent2: The midwife was midwiving the birth smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The stork joked about midwiving the newborns to the families.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice was midwiving the baby's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The doctor was midwiving the safe delivery of the child.

meanings.definition: To support or facilitate the development of something
meanings.sent1: The mentor was midwiving the growth of the young artist.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was midwiving the students' creativity in class.
meanings.sent3: The coach was midwiving the team's victory with strategic plays.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement was midwiving his confidence to try new things.
meanings.sent5: The community was midwiving the construction of the new playground.
